div.l: Lo where þey gone ȝe lat þᵉ chyldre pley
Þei gete hym not so lythly by my croune
Þis seli clerkes rennen vp ⁊and doune4100
Wᵗith kepe kepe stand stand Ioste þe war de rere
Go whystell þᵘou ⁊and I shall kepe hym here
But shortly to hit was verrey nyth
Þey couth not wᵗith boþe her myth
Her caple cache he ran awey so faste4105
Tyl in a dyche þei cauth hym at þᵉ laste
Wery ⁊and wete as bestes ben in reyne
Cometh sely Iohn ⁊and aft̉er hym Aleyn
Allas qduod Iohn þᵉ day þᵗat I was boren
Now be we dryuen to hethyn ⁊and to skorn4110
Oure corn is stolen men wyl vs fals calle
Bothe þᵉ wardeyn ⁊and oure felawes alle
And namely þᵉ myller waylaway
Þus pleyneth Iohn as he goth by þᵉ way
Toward þᵉ mylle ⁊and bayard in his hand
Þe myller sittynge by þᵉ fyr þei fond
For hit was nyth ⁊and forther myth þei not
But for þᵉ loue of god þei hym besouth
Of herborewe ⁊and of ese for her peny
Þᵉ myller answered aȝen ȝif þ̉erbe any4120
Such as hit is ȝut shull ȝe haue ȝoure part
Myn house is is streyt but ȝe haue lered art
Ȝe can by argument make a place
A myle brod of xxᵗⁱ fote of space
Lat se now ȝif þis place may suffice
Or maketh hit more wᵗith speche as is ȝour͗e gyse
Now symond seid þis Iohn by seynt Cuthbert4127
